column4: Hi, trying to upgrade from Natty to Oneiric. I'm getting "E:Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages." However, apt-get autoremove, doesn't change anything, nor does apt-get -f. This is the apt log from the upgrade tool: http://pastebin.com/raw.php?i=e0krQALw
@ is not a special character in shells
I know it's not but bash might strip the backslash out.
Try dpkg -l and look for packages with something other than ii in the first two columns.
some packages are marked as removed with residual configuration, that's all.
That's not very helpful, is it?
sorry?
Just a comment.
would you like the list of packages that aren't "ii"?
No, that status isn't anywhere broken.
FWIW, synaptic reports 0 packages broken
That's no help either.
Are you currently running a 64 bit kernel?
OK I suspect the "broken" messages have nothing to do with your existing packages.
It's more like the upgrade has issues.
I'd advise a fresh install.

the reason I've been reluctant to do a fresh install is that this is a company-provided computer. There is no /home partition (everything on /), and I don't have enough HD space to back everything up.
usb drive?
I could, potentially, resize the current / partition, install the new distribution on whatever space I have available (something like 80GB), and then change the old partition to become my /home.
I have mint 11 on my home server, I've been waiting for MATE to become a bit more stable before throwing 12 on it. It finally seems usable, so I'll go for that.
It's working well for me.  I really only use the netbook actively.  The server just sits there and runs programs/backups etc.
